name: express-sample
description: https://github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh awsome commandline tool that shows what branch you're on npm init: creates a node project, adds in package.json npm install express --save: saves the installed package in the package.json npm install express: express loads just locally in node modules folder .gitignore: you don't track node_modules with git src dir: used to store application files 'use strict': save from common mistakes by throwing an error if you make one, check out http://teamtreehouse.com/library/the-javascript-use-strict-statement
author: Nate Brenner
